meanings.definition: To view or present in a romantic way.
meanings.sent1: She likes to romanticise old love letters.
meanings.sent2: He tends to romanticise his memories of childhood.
meanings.sent3: The movie exaggeratedly romanticised the historical events.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings romanticise the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent5: In her stories, she always romanticises the idea of true love.

meanings.definition: To make something seem more attractive or exciting than it really is.
meanings.sent1: He tends to romanticise the idea of living in a big city.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement tried to romanticise the benefits of the product.
meanings.sent3: She always romanticises the taste of her cooking, but it's just average.
meanings.sent4: The travel brochure romanticised the simplicity of rural life.
meanings.sent5: Don't romanticise the difficulties of starting a business; it's hard work.
